722954f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [Across the North (Hudson) River - Tiemann Place - 125th Street (West).]
722954f-a.text:
Riverside Park, north from a point in same, near Tiemann Place and showing tracks of the New York Central Railroad paralleling the North (Hudson) River, with piers and a ferry (Fort Lee, New Jersey) landing at
the foot of West 125th Street.
About 1890.
Ewing Galloway.
722954f-a.folder: Riverside Park & [Across the North (Hudson) River & Tiemann Place & 125th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY

722929f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.
722929f-a.text: Riverside Park: A view showing General U.S. Grants Tomb beyond a squatters shack. February 13, 1901. Gift of Randall Comfort.
722929f-a.folder: Riverside Park & Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb., Manhattan, NY

722867f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722867f-a.text: Riverside Park: The West 72nd Street entrance. This photograph appeared in a brochure published by the Department of Parks on the occasion of the opening of the West Side Improvement Project on October 12, 1937. 1908. Gift of Department of Parks.

722895f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 89th Street (West).
722895f-a.text:
Naval Review.  Oct. 1, 1912
The fleet at night. Structure illuminated in foreground
is Soldiers & Sailors Monument.
Photo News Dept. American Press Association
25 West 39th St., New York City

722944f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - Claremont Inn - Between 72nd and 125th Streets (West).
722944f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views showing Claremont Inn overlooking the Hudson River with the U.S. Fleet thereon. This historic site is at the northern tip of this elongated grassy strip that parallels the river
from West 72nd to 125th Streets.
October 13, 1912.
Walter L. Bogert.
722944f-a.folder: Riverside Park & Claremont Inn & Between 72nd and 125th Streets (West)., Manhattan, NY

722953f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [Recreation Pier - St. Clair - 129th Street (West).]
722953f-b.text:
Riverside Bark: Two views from the northern extremity of same, across the Hudson River to the Palisades of New Jersey. Layiug at anchor amidstream are vessels of the U.S. Navy on display. No. 1 of this set is northward to show the Recreation Pier at the foot of St. Clair (West 129th) Street, while No. 2 shows the Pergola which is the vantage point for No. 1.
May 10, 1915.
Walter L. Bogert.
722953f-b.folder: Riverside Park & [Recreation Pier & St. Clair & 129th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY

722953f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [Recreation Pier - St. Clair - 129th Street (West).]
722953f-a.text:
Riverside Bark: Two views from the northern extremity of same, across the Hudson River to the Palisades of New Jersey. Layiug at anchor amidstream are vessels of the U.S. Navy on display. No. 1 of this set is northward to show the Recreation Pier at the foot of St. Clair (West 129th) Street, while No. 2 shows the Pergola which is the vantage point for No. 1.
May 10, 1915.
Walter L. Bogert.
722953f-a.folder: Riverside Park & [Recreation Pier & St. Clair & 129th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY

722943f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 122nd Street (West).
722943f-b.text:
Riverside Park: Three views in a southwestward direction across the Hudson River from a point near General U.S. Grants'Tomb (West 122nd Street). Lying amid stream is the U.S. Fleet on display and silhouetted
against the JJersey highland.
May 10, 1915.
Walter L. Bogert.

722943f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 122nd Street (West).
722943f-c.text:
Riverside Park: Three views in a southwestward direction across the Hudson River from a point near General U.S. Grants'Tomb (West 122nd Street). Lying amid stream is the U.S. Fleet on display and silhouetted
against the JJersey highland.
May 10, 1915.
Walter L. Bogert.

722943f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 122nd Street (West).
722943f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Three views in a southwestward direction across the Hudson River from a point near General U.S. Grants'Tomb (West 122nd Street). Lying amid stream is the U.S. Fleet on display and silhouetted
against the JJersey highland.
May 10, 1915.
Walter L. Bogert.

722866f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722866f-a.text:
Riverside Park: The marginal lands and New York Central Railroad tracks as viewed northward from West 72nd Street. Compare this with view taken in 1937 at the completion of the West Side Improvement Project; this photograph being published in a brochure at that date.
1915.
Gift of Department of Parks.

722942f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [The U. S. Fleet near Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.]
722942f-b.text:
Riverside Park: Three views westward and southwestward across the Hudson River to the highlands of New Jersey. Amid stream are vessels of the United States Fleet on one of their periodic visits to New York.
Photographers vantage point is near Grants Tomb.
June 28, 1919.
Walter L. Bogert.
722942f-b.folder: Riverside Park & [The U. S. Fleet near Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.], Manhattan, NY

722942f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [The U. S. Fleet near Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.]
722942f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Three views westward and southwestward across the Hudson River to the highlands of New Jersey. Amid stream are vessels of the United States Fleet on one of their periodic visits to New York.
Photographers vantage point is near Grants Tomb.
June 28, 1919.
Walter L. Bogert.
722942f-a.folder: Riverside Park & [The U. S. Fleet near Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.], Manhattan, NY

722942f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [The U. S. Fleet near Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.]
722942f-c.text:
Riverside Park: Three views westward and southwestward across the Hudson River to the highlands of New Jersey. Amid stream are vessels of the United States Fleet on one of their periodic visits to New York.
Photographers vantage point is near Grants Tomb.
June 28, 1919.
Walter L. Bogert.
722942f-c.folder: Riverside Park & [The U. S. Fleet near Ulysses S. Grant's Tomb.], Manhattan, NY

722955f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 132nd Street (West).
722955f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Looking north along the New York Central tracks, showing grade crossing elimination at 132nd Street.
October l6, 1925

722886f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 81st Street (West).
722886f-a.text:
Rtiverside Park: A northward view in same from a point on a line with West 81st Street, showing the marginal lands being filled in preparatory to landscaping. In 1937, civic authorities will throw open to the public this redesigned area in a form difficult to recognize. A brochure was published at that time under the title "The West Side Tmprovement Project' containing photographs and written matter pertinent
to this locality.
March 29, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

722947f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - [Across the North (Hudson) River - Tiemann Place - 125th Street (West).]
722947f-a.text:
Riverside Park, northwestward across the North (Hudson) River from a point in same,near Tiemann Place. Shown at the foot of West 125th Street is a recreation pier and just beyond, the Fort Lee, New Jersey Ferry. In the background appears the new George Washington Bridge.
June 14, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
722947f-a.folder: Riverside Park & [Across the North (Hudson) River & Tiemann Place & 125th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY

722873f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 75th Street (West).
722873f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A northward view from a point on a line with West 75th Street, showing the marginal lands being filled preparatory to landscaping,and the New York Central Railroad tracks. The latter will be shifted to the graded bed seen in the foreground and later covered
over by a concrete Viaduct.
July 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

722885f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722885f-b.text:
(1 & 2)
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views at 79th Street, showing the tracks of the New York Central Railroad that are between the Drive (buildings thereon) and the North River. These will be covered over and the marginal lands landscaped under a joint project of the Park Department and the Railroad Company which will be completed and opened to the public in late 1937.
July 11. 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same area, photographer being at about 75th Street and showing the tracks entering the yards below 72nd Street. Note the buildings on the latter street which form an ell at the southern
extremity of the Drive.
July 11, 1931.

722885f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722885f-c.text:
(1 & 2)
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views at 79th Street, showing the tracks of the New York Central Railroad that are between the Drive (buildings thereon) and the North River. These will be covered over and the marginal lands landscaped under a joint project of the Park Department and the Railroad Company which will be completed and opened to the public in late 1937.
July 11. 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same area, photographer being at about 75th Street and showing the tracks entering the yards below 72nd Street. Note the buildings on the latter street which form an ell at the southern
extremity of the Drive.
July 11, 1931.

722885f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722885f-a.text:
(1 & 2)
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views at 79th Street, showing the tracks of the New York Central Railroad that are between the Drive (buildings thereon) and the North River. These will be covered over and the marginal lands landscaped under a joint project of the Park Department and the Railroad Company which will be completed and opened to the public in late 1937.
July 11. 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same area, photographer being at about 75th Street and showing the tracks entering the yards below 72nd Street. Note the buildings on the latter street which form an ell at the southern
extremity of the Drive.
July 11, 1931.

722970f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 152nd Street (West).
722970f-a.text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 152nd Street, showing shacks and house-boats occupying the marginal strip at the waters edge.
Buildings in the background are on Riverside Drive, extending from 151st on right, to 156th Street on the left. At the latter point is the 13 story Rivera. Trinity Cemetery nestles in the hollow to the center, and is encircled by a steel viaduct carrying the Drive.
April 13, 1934
Views: 1-2
P. L. Sperr

722876f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West) - [Aerial view.]
722876f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A northward view of same and its environs from a point over West 79th Street,showing this area prior to the radical changes that are planned, by what is known as the West Side Improvement Project. The white line appearing on the left indicates the new shore line. Through the center runs the serpentine like tracks of tne New York Central Railroad. Forming the eastern boundary of this marginal area is Riverside Drive. Compare this with a September 15, 1937 photograph (north from 72nd Street),both of which were published by the Park Department on October 12, 1937 in a brochure titled "The West Side
Improvement Project."
Fall 1934.
Gift of Departmwunt of Parks.
722876f-a.folder: Riverside Park & 79th Street (West) & [Aerial view.], Manhattan, NY

722879f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722879f-a.text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 79th Street, showing the information board locating the various U. S. vessels during their visit to New York City.
June 17, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722912f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 97th Street (West).
722912f-a.text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 97th Street, showing the landing platform during the U. S. Fleets visit; an annual
event.
June 17, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722913f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 98th Street (West).
722913f-c.text:
Rtiverside Park, north from a point in same near West 98th Street. This set consists of 3 views; Nos. 2 and 3 being slightly northward. Note the New York Central Railroad tracks that parallel the river. In 1938 these will be lost to view; the West Side Improvement Project
causing same to be moved eastward and covered in.
June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722913f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 98th Street (West).
722913f-a.text:
Rtiverside Park, north from a point in same near West 98th Street. This set consists of 3 views; Nos. 2 and 3 being slightly northward. Note the New York Central Railroad tracks that parallel the river. In 1938 these will be lost to view; the West Side Improvement Project
causing same to be moved eastward and covered in.
June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722913f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 98th Street (West).
722913f-b.text:
Rtiverside Park, north from a point in same near West 98th Street. This set consists of 3 views; Nos. 2 and 3 being slightly northward. Note the New York Central Railroad tracks that parallel the river. In 1938 these will be lost to view; the West Side Improvement Project
causing same to be moved eastward and covered in.
June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722890f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - Between 76th and 83rd Streets (West).
722890f-b.folder: Riverside Park & Between 76th and 83rd Streets (West)., Manhattan, NY

722890f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - Between 76th and 83rd Streets (West).
722890f-a.folder: Riverside Park & Between 76th and 83rd Streets (West)., Manhattan, NY

722941f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - U. S. battleships.
722941f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views westward from an undetermined point in same across the Hudson River to the Jersey highlands. Shown at anchor amid-stream are the U.S. battleships Tennessee and Pennsylvania
in Nos. 1 and 2 respectively.
June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
722941f-a.folder: Riverside Park & U. S. battleships., Manhattan, NY

722941f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - U. S. battleships.
722941f-b.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 2 views westward from an undetermined point in same across the Hudson River to the Jersey highlands. Shown at anchor amid-stream are the U.S. battleships Tennessee and Pennsylvania
in Nos. 1 and 2 respectively.
June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
722941f-b.folder: Riverside Park & U. S. battleships., Manhattan, NY

722888f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 82nd Street (West).
722888f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A view south from West 82nd Street, showing the southerly portion of this marginal park between Riverside (left) and the North (Hudson) River in a state of metamorphoSis. This work is being conducted under the jcint auspices of the Department of Parks and the New York Central Railroad in what is better known as the West Side Improvement Project. The unsightly railroad tracks are being enclosed in a concrete viaduct; the top of which will carry automotive traffic. A brochure including this photograph was published by the Park Department on October 12, 1937 for the ceremonies attending the opening.
November 1936.
Gift of Department of Parks.

722926f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 199th Street
722926f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A small tots' sandpile near West 119th Street. In the center background is General Grant's Tomb. This photograph was published by the Department of Parks on the opening of the West Side Improvement Project on October 12, 1937. In comparison to same was shown a Riverside Drive view of l900 showing bicyclers in the same area; for which see files under that classification.
1937.
Samuel H. 0ottscho.
Gift of Department of Parks.

722865f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722865f-a.text:
Riverside Park : The marginal lands and the enclosed viaduct that covers the New York Central Railroad tracks as viewed northward from W. 72nd Street. Note the radical changes effected in this area by the West Side Improvement Project which at this point was under the joint auspices of the Department of Parks and the Railroad Company. Compare this photograph with one taken in 1915 from this vantage point, both being incorporated in a brochure published by the Park Department on October 12, 1937.
1937.
Samuel H. Gottscho
Gift of Department of Parks

722868f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722868f-a.text:
Riverside Park: The West 72nd Street entrance after completion of the West Side Improvement Project. Note the radical changes from 1908. This photograph was included in a brochure published by the Department of Parks on the completion and opening of this Project on October 12,
1937.
1937.
Gift of Departmment of Parks

722887f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 82nd Street (West).
722887f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A view south from West 82nd Street, showing the southerly portion of this marginal park between Riverside Drive (left) and the North (Hudson) River, showing the radical changes effected in this area by the West Side Improvement Project under the joint auspices of the Department of Parks and the New York Central Railroad. This photograph was included in a brochure published by the Department of Parks and issued for the opening ceremonies on October 12, 1937.
September 1937.
Samuel H. Gottscho.
Gift of Department of Parks.
Neg# 3457

722889f.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 82nd Street (West).
722889f.text:
Riverside Park: The childrens playground at 82nd Street on marginal lands after completion of the West Side Improvement Project. This photograph appeared in a publication issued on October 12, 1937.
1937.
Samuel H. Gottscho.
Gift of Department of Parks.

722877f.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722877f.text:
Riverside Park, at West 79th Street, and showing a causeway at that point that carries automotive traffic northward from the West Side Elevated Highway to the Henry Hudson Parkway. Underneath this structure are the tracks of the New York Central Railroad; they having been enclosed and the marginal lands landscaped under joint auspices of the Railroad Company and the Park Department in the West Side Improvement Project. Photographer is viewing southwestward towards the North (Hudson)
River, which is on the far side of same.
January 28, 1938.
George D. Chinn.

722869f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722869f-b.text:
Riverside Park, north from West 72nd treet, showing the marginal lands prior to improvement and landscaping. The major feature .f this project will be the enclosure of the New York Central Railroad Tracks. At the dock at 79th Street lay the "Succaneer" and the "Constitution. No. 2 shows construction details of the 74th-75th area. No. 3 is from the original vantage point. Note here the U. S. Fleet at anchor and on display, also the absence of the old ships slown in View 1.
Viewl: March 19, 1930
View2: July 11, 1931
View3: June 11, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722869f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722869f-a.text:
Riverside Park, north from West 72nd treet, showing the marginal lands prior to improvement and landscaping. The major feature .f this project will be the enclosure of the New York Central Railroad Tracks. At the dock at 79th Street lay the "Succaneer" and the "Constitution. No. 2 shows construction details of the 74th-75th area. No. 3 is from the original vantage point. Note here the U. S. Fleet at anchor and on display, also the absence of the old ships slown in View 1.
Viewl: March 19, 1930
View2: July 11, 1931
View3: June 11, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722869f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722869f-c.text:
Riverside Park, north from West 72nd treet, showing the marginal lands prior to improvement and landscaping. The major feature .f this project will be the enclosure of the New York Central Railroad Tracks. At the dock at 79th Street lay the "Succaneer" and the "Constitution. No. 2 shows construction details of the 74th-75th area. No. 3 is from the original vantage point. Note here the U. S. Fleet at anchor and on display, also the absence of the old ships slown in View 1.
Viewl: March 19, 1930
View2: July 11, 1931
View3: June 11, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722871f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722871f-a.text:
Riverside Park, north from West 72nd Street, showing the New York Central Railroad tracks,prior to enclosure as a portion of the West Side Improvement Project. Mote the wooden fornis in poation and the concrete retaining walls resulting from same. In 1937 a top will be installed and the extension of the Henry Hudson Parkway run on same. This. in conjunction with hajor landscaping jobs
will radical ly change the appearance.
View 1: July 11, 1931
View 2: April 3, 1932
View 3: June 1, 1934
P. L. Serr

722871f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722871f-c.text:
Riverside Park, north from West 72nd Street, showing the New York Central Railroad tracks,prior to enclosure as a portion of the West Side Improvement Project. Mote the wooden fornis in poation and the concrete retaining walls resulting from same. In 1937 a top will be installed and the extension of the Henry Hudson Parkway run on same. This. in conjunction with hajor landscaping jobs
will radical ly change the appearance.
View 1: July 11, 1931
View 2: April 3, 1932
View 3: June 1, 1934
P. L. Serr

722871f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 72nd Street (West).
722871f-b.text:
Riverside Park, north from West 72nd Street, showing the New York Central Railroad tracks,prior to enclosure as a portion of the West Side Improvement Project. Mote the wooden fornis in poation and the concrete retaining walls resulting from same. In 1937 a top will be installed and the extension of the Henry Hudson Parkway run on same. This. in conjunction with hajor landscaping jobs
will radical ly change the appearance.
View 1: July 11, 1931
View 2: April 3, 1932
View 3: June 1, 1934
P. L. Serr

722882f-c.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722882f-c.text:
Riverside Park: A series of 3 views showing foot of West 79th Street as viewed from a point to the south of
Same.
No. 1 shows the sailing vessels "The Buccaneer" and "The Constitution", the New York Central Railroad tracks and the excavation work for the West Side Improvement Project. Neg# 3456
No's 2 and 3 show mainly the Railroad tracks and the 79th Street crossing. In the last two the U. S. Navy is on display, an annual event.
View 1: September 8, 1931
View 2: September 29, 1932
View 3: June 11, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722882f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722882f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A series of 3 views showing foot of West 79th Street as viewed from a point to the south of
Same.
No. 1 shows the sailing vessels "The Buccaneer" and "The Constitution", the New York Central Railroad tracks and the excavation work for the West Side Improvement Project. Neg# 3456
No's 2 and 3 show mainly the Railroad tracks and the 79th Street crossing. In the last two the U. S. Navy is on display, an annual event.
View 1: September 8, 1931
View 2: September 29, 1932
View 3: June 11, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722882f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722882f-b.text:
Riverside Park: A series of 3 views showing foot of West 79th Street as viewed from a point to the south of
Same.
No. 1 shows the sailing vessels "The Buccaneer" and "The Constitution", the New York Central Railroad tracks and the excavation work for the West Side Improvement Project. Neg# 3456
No's 2 and 3 show mainly the Railroad tracks and the 79th Street crossing. In the last two the U. S. Navy is on display, an annual event.
View 1: September 8, 1931
View 2: September 29, 1932
View 3: June 11, 1934
P. L. Sperr

722880f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722880f-b.text:
Riverside Park, foot of 79th Street, west of Riverside Drive. This shows a view of the Hudson River with a sailing ship called the "Buccaneer."

An earlier view showing the coal pocket at the rivers edge as seen in a northward direction.
View 1: June 16, 1928
View 2: April 14, 1924
P. L. Spcrr

722880f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 79th Street (West).
722880f-a.text:
Riverside Park, foot of 79th Street, west of Riverside Drive. This shows a view of the Hudson River with a sailing ship called the "Buccaneer."

An earlier view showing the coal pocket at the rivers edge as seen in a northward direction.
View 1: June 16, 1928
View 2: April 14, 1924
P. L. Spcrr
